The Armory

Below you will find a set of curated tools, programs, and resources that are invaluable to any aspiring Cyber Knight. Just as a knight wields a wide variety of lethal armaments, Cyber Knights should arm themselves with a wide range of weapons. Learn to wield them well and you will be a formidable combatant on the digital battlefield.

Linux Distributions for Information Technology Students:

  • Kali Linux(Penetration Testing Linux Distribution)
  • Linux Mint(Debian/Ubuntu Based Linux Distribution)
  • openSUSE(Debian Based Linux Distribution)
  • Ubuntu(Debian Based Linux Distribution)

Resources for Information Technology Students:

  • Certutil in Windows(hashing files (md5sum, SHA1, etc.))
  • Enable and Disable Ping(Windows 10 Firewall)
  • Enabling F8(Windows Server Safe Mode)
  • Enabling Virtualization in your PC BIOS
  • Internet Protocol(IPv4) Subnet Chart
  • Linux DHCO configuration file explained(/etc/dhcp/dhcpd.conf)
  • Linux File Permissions, chmod, and umask(Symbolic and Octal Notation)
  • Linux Man (Manual) Pages(Look up Linux Command Line (CLI) Commands etc.)
  • Linux NTP server and client installation and configuration
  • md5sum on MAC OS X
  • Notepad++(Text Editor for Microsoft Windows)
  • Oracle VirtualBox
  • Oracle VirtualBox: "Kernel Driver Not Installed (rc=-1908)" Error on Mac
  • Print Style Sheet(Tips, Tricks, and How-to)
  • SHA1 in Mac OS X
  • Storing and Retrieving Images from SQL Server (C#)
  • Supernetting / CIDR Chart
  • Variable Length Subnet Mask (VLSM) Explained with Examples
  • Vi Commands (Basic Commands for the Vi Text Editor)
  • W3C HTML Validator
  • W3C CSS Validator
  • w3schools HTML Tutorial(Tutorial guide for programming languages)
  • Web Development Tutorials(MGA School of Computing Department of Intormation Technology)


  • Metasploit
  • MSFvenom
  • Pivoting
  • Post-Exploitation
